memberdef.argsstring: (int week, double upstream_source_inflow, double wastewater_inflow, vector< double > &demand_outflow)=0
memberdef.name: applyContinuity

detaileddescription.para:
Does not apply continuity to the water source, by instead just treats it as non existing, i.e. outflow = inflow + catchment_flow
week
total_upstream_inflow
Total inflow released from the upstream water source, excluding water for the catchment between both water sources.

memberdef.argsstring: (int week, double upstream_source_inflow, double wastewater_inflow, vector< double > &demand_outflow)
memberdef.name: continuityWaterSource

detaileddescription.para:
Applies continuity to the water source.
week
upstream_source_inflow
Total inflow released from the upstream water source, excluding water for the catchment between both water sources.
demand_outflow
demand from utility.

If creating a new water source that can be allocated to different utilities, this function must be overwritten to: available_allocated_volumes[allocation_id] -= volume; available_volume -= volume; demand += volume;
utility_id

If creating a new water source that can be allocated to different utilities, this function must be overwritten to: return available_allocated_volumes[utility_id];
utility_id

Set inflows, evaporation and rdm values for water source for a given utility r
r
rdm_factors
table with one realization per row in which the first column is the evaporation multiplier, followed by pairs of values for each source representing permitting time and construction cost.

inbodydescription.para:
Update total catchment inflow, demand, and available water volume for week 0;
Set permitting times according to corresponding rdm factors.
Set construction cost overruns according to corresponding rdm factors.

detaileddescription.para:
Most sources will not have different allocations, so by default this function will return the total capacity. If a source is to have multiple allocations, this function must be overriden to make sure it returns the right value.
utility_id

Initial set up of allocations with full reservoir in the beginning of the simulations. To be used in constructors only.
utilities_with_allocations
allocated_fractions
